official-title.#text:
To amend the Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act and the egg,
		  meat, and poultry inspection laws to ensure that consumers receive notification
		  regarding food products produced from crops, livestock, or poultry raised on
		  land on which sewage sludge was applied.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail:
,
			 for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

short-title.#text:
Sewage Sludge in Food Production
			 Consumer Notification Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Notification to
			 consumers of food products produced on land on which sewage sludge has been
			 applied

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

act-name.#text: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:402

header.#text:
Adulterated food
			 under federal food, drug, and cosmetic act

quoted-block.@act-name: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, if it is a
				food (intended for human consumption and offered for sale) that was produced,
				or contains any ingredient that was produced, on land on which sewage sludge
				was applied, unless—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Sewage Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act

short-title.#text:
Sewage
				Sludge in Food Production Consumer Notification Act

text.#text:
Effective one year after
				the date of the enactment of the

the food bears a
				label that clearly indicates that the food, or an ingredient of the food, was
				produced on land on which sewage sludge was applied; or

in the case of a
				raw agricultural commodity or other food generally offered for sale without
				labeling, a sign is posted within close proximity of the food to notify
				consumers that the food, or an ingredient of the food, was produced on land on
				which sewage sludge was applied.

quote.#tail:
has the meaning given to such term in section 503.9(w) of title
				40, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor
				regulations).

National Organic Program of the Department of
			 Agriculture

text.#text:
Nothing in this section or the amendments made by this
			 section shall be construed to modify the prohibition contained in part 205 of
			 title 7, Code of Federal Regulations, on the use of sewage sludge, including
			 ash, grit, or screenings from the production of sewage sludge, in organic food
			 production under the

quote.#tail:
has the meaning given to such term in section 503.9(w) of title
			 40, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulations), except that
			 such term includes ash generated during the firing of sewage sludge in a sewage
			 sludge incinerator or grit and screenings generated during preliminary
			 treatment of domestic sewage in a treatment works.
